meanings.definition: To dress or adorn oneself in a fancy or stylish manner.
meanings.sent1: She dolled up for the party in a sparkly dress.
meanings.sent2: She dolled herself up with makeup and jewelry.
meanings.sent3: He dolled up in a silly costume for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The room was dolled up with colorful decorations.
meanings.sent5: The garden was dolled up with beautiful flowers.

meanings.definition: To make something appear more attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: She dolled up the room with fairy lights.
meanings.sent2: The chef dolled up the dish with a garnish.
meanings.sent3: He dolled up his story to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The artist dolled up the painting with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The designer dolled up the dress with intricate details.

meanings.definition: To treat someone with excessive care or attention.
meanings.sent1: She dolled over her pet cat, giving it treats all day.
meanings.sent2: The nurse dolled over the patient, ensuring their comfort.
meanings.sent3: He dolled over his little sister, always checking on her.
meanings.sent4: The teacher dolled over the students, praising their efforts.
meanings.sent5: The grandmother dolled over her grandchildren, spoiling them with gifts.
